result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnnie Eddie Rice

records.addlTxt: of commitment for treatment (Incompetency), signed and filed.

Defendant Johnnie Eddie Rice appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Johnnie Eddie Rice.  Prosecuting attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Competency hearing held. Parties stipulate to the qualifications of the State's witness. Sworn for the State: Karyn Gust-Brey - Psychology Director at MMHI. Court takes judicial notice of the doctor's report filed on 9/7/22 by Dr. Breanna Arnold. Court places finding of fact and analysis on the record. For reasons stated on the record, Court finds the defendant incompetent but is likely to be restored to competency within the statutory time period if provided with continued treatment. Court finds defendant does not need involuntary administration of medication. Case is adjourned to Br. 36.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnnie Eddie Rice appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Johnnie Eddie Rice.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a return on Doctor's Report.  It is the opinion of Doctor Breanna Arnold that Mr. Rice is not competent to assist in his own defense but likely to be restored to competency within the statutory timeframe if provided continued treatment.  Parties contest the Doctor's findings and request a competency hearing.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Court approves Zoom appearances at the next court date.  

Doctor Gust-Brey informs the Clerk by email that Doctor Arnold is no longer at MMHI,  However, Doctor Gust-Brey supervised Doctor Arnold and is willing to testify, but she did not directly meet with Mr. Rice.
Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.
Competency hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Johnnie Eddie Rice in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Johnnie Eddie Rice in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case set for Competency Hearing.   Competency Hearing proceeded.  State does not challenge Dr. Seipel's report however, defense does challenge the report. Sworn for the State:  Dr. Matthew Seipel.  Testimony closed.  Arguments heard.

After review of all evidence, report and testimony of Dr. Seipel, Court finds defendant incompetent to proceed at this time but is likely to become competent.  Court found the defendant is not competent to refuse psychotropic medication or treatment due to mental illness because the defendant is incapable of expressing an understanding of the advantages and disadvantages of accepting psychotropic medication or treatment.  Court ordered defendant commitment for treatment for incompetency.  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.  The sheriff shall arrange for transportation of the defendant to the treatment facility.  

The Department of Health and Family Services is authorized to administer psychotropic medication or treatment to the defendant, and shall observe appropriate medical standards.  Court ordered case adjourned, Branch 38.  **  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Johnnie Eddie Rice not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case set for Competency hearing. Court needs to adjourn this matter. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Competency hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Johnnie Eddie Rice not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Competency hearing. Defendant unable to be produced to the court due to external issues. Case adjourned, branch 38.  Competency hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Johnnie Eddie Rice in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Johnnie Eddie Rice in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson on behalf of Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Return on Doctor's Report. Parties in receipt of Dr. Seipel's report. State does not challenge the report however, defense does challenge the report. Defense request a competency hearing. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Competency hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE on next court date.

Defendant Johnnie Eddie Rice in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Johnnie Eddie Rice in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Johnnie Eddie Rice appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Commissioner tolls the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/ed5b9ae0-0153-fff4-9924-88d8db5a37c1  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Order for Competency Examination, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
